com.itko.lisa.testing

Class RegressionRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • com.itko.lisa.testing.RegressionRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.itko.lisa.testing.LisaTestCase, junit.framework.Test

    public class RegressionRunner
extends junit.framework.TestCase
implements com.itko.lisa.testing.LisaTestCase
    This class is the driver for all regression testing in LISA. There really isn't much need for LISA users to digest much of this at the Javadoc level. For that matter, this is true for all of the classes in the .testing package. If you are a LISA developer wanting to implement regressions, please refer to the User's Guide chapter on Regression Testing with LISA. This class will construct a RegressionRunner for every test that should be run in a JUnit suite. Note that it extends the junit TestCase class. Each of those test cases will run (in sequence, not parallel). Each RegressionRunner object will report as a junit TestCase should up to the framework so you can collect a total and do stats. To do this programmatically: 1) call reset() so there's no incest 2) call setTestRegistry(), even if it's just to null it 3) call addRegressions() to give us the suite document to load up 4) call runTest/GUIRegression() to make it happen
